title: How to Make Spaghetti in a Short Time

steps.headline: The first thing to do is get your water boiling in a pot and have the stove set on high.
steps.description: Fill the pot with water about ¾ of the way.

steps.headline: While the water is heating up, you can get together everything you are going to need to make the dinner.
Get out the regular spaghetti noodles and grab them around as if you are making a small circle with your fingers (if it is for one person).
steps.description: Then break them in half so that they will be easier to eat.

steps.headline: Make sure to have a pasta strainer in the sink for when the noodles are done cooking.
After a few minutes or so the water should begin boiling or at least be bubbling.
steps.description: At this point you can put the noodles in the water.

steps.headline: Then lower the temperature on the stove to somewhere between medium and high.
You will want to stir the noodles every few minutes so they do not get suck to each other or to the pot.
While the noodles are cooking, you can get out anything else you might want on your spaghetti.
steps.description: I tend to get out pasta sauce to put in a bowl and heat up in the microwave. Other common favorites are parmesan cheese or basil to sprinkle on the finished project.

steps.headline: After the spaghetti has been cooking for about ten minutes you can use a spoon to scoop out a few noodles to taste and see if they are done.
steps.description: Some people like to throw them against the wall and say they are done if they stick to the wall.

steps.headline: After tasting or seeing if they are ready, you can pour the noodles into the strainer in the sink.
Shake the strainer for a bit to make sure all the water is out.
Then if you like butter on your pasta, I suggest putting butter in the pot, pouring the spaghetti back, and stirring the butter into it.
steps.description: You only need about an 1/8 of a stick of margarine to do this.

steps.headline: Lastly, you can place your pasta on a plate and eat up!
steps.description: Add sauce, cheese, or basil if you would like and enjoy!

text: The first thing to do is get your water boiling in a pot and have the stove set on high. Fill the pot with water about ¾ of the way. While the water is heating up, you can get together everything you are going to need to make the dinner.  Get out the regular spaghetti noodles and grab them around as if you are making a small circle with your fingers (if it is for one person). Then break them in half so that they will be easier to eat. Make sure to have a pasta strainer in the sink for when the noodles are done cooking.  After a few minutes or so the water should begin boiling or at least be bubbling. At this point you can put the noodles in the water. Then lower the temperature on the stove to somewhere between medium and high.  You will want to stir the noodles every few minutes so they do not get suck to each other or to the pot.  While the noodles are cooking, you can get out anything else you might want on your spaghetti. I tend to get out pasta sauce to put in a bowl and heat up in the microwave. Other common favorites are parmesan cheese or basil to sprinkle on the finished project. After the spaghetti has been cooking for about ten minutes you can use a spoon to scoop out a few noodles to taste and see if they are done. Some people like to throw them against the wall and say they are done if they stick to the wall. After tasting or seeing if they are ready, you can pour the noodles into the strainer in the sink.  Shake the strainer for a bit to make sure all the water is out.  Then if you like butter on your pasta, I suggest putting butter in the pot, pouring the spaghetti back, and stirring the butter into it. You only need about an 1/8 of a stick of margarine to do this. Lastly, you can place your pasta on a plate and eat up! Add sauce, cheese, or basil if you would like and enjoy! Finished.
